title: Adds a missing "the"
body: The following sentence is missing the bracketed word (i.e., "the"): "ggplot2 provides over 20 stats for you to use. Each stat is a function, so you can get help in [the] usual way"

title: wrong labels in Figure 12.3
body: In Figure 12.3, the variables names for table2 do not match what is actually in `table2`. The last two columns should be called `type` and `count`.

title: Add `show.legend = FALSE` mentioned in exercise
body: The example wants to show different ways of producing the same plot (as done in the print version). One of the exercises refers to a `show.legend = FALSE` used previously. This change brings the parts back into harmony.

title: difference in definition of tidy data between r4ds and tidy data paper
body:
First off, I have not found discussion of this topic anywhere, but it could exist somewhere casual like a twitter conversation. 

I noticed a slight rewording of the rules governing tidy data in r4ds when compared to the original tidy data paper. Rule 3 has changed from "Each type of observational unit forms a table" to "Each value must have its own cell." This change seems to have consequences that affect the examples in the original paper. In particular, under the r4ds rules, I think table 8 in the paper is technically tidy already, and does not need to be normalized into table 13.

Does this change reflect an evolution in the tidy philosophy?

title: 3.5.1 Exercises #4: "arguments" may be better than "variables"
body:
The question reads

> Why doesn’t `facet_grid()` have `nrow` and `ncol` variables?

In my opinion, it would be slightly more clear as

> Why doesn’t `facet_grid()` have `nrow` and `ncol` arguments?

title: wrong graphs p16
body: the graphs on p16 do not match the code provided

title: Answers to questions
body: I'm relatively new to R. Have taken a few short intro courses but am now trying to use your book to get a more solid foundation of the basics. The exercises are great but without knowing if I've got the answers right or wrong I'm not always sure if I'm getting them.

title: Pre-Order to Order
body: Changing from Pre Order to Order

title: Wrong figure text labels chapter 21.7
body:
Hadley on the figure for mapping mulitple argument the 3 calls rnorm(mu = .... ) shoild use 

rnorm(mean = ... )

title: answers for exercise questions
body: Hi, I'm relatively new to R and working through  R4DS and each sections exercises.  Will there be any plan to produce answers to the exercise questions so I can check I am on the right track?

title: Migrate style guide enhancements from r-pkgs
body: https://github.com/hadley/r-pkgs/pull/399#issuecomment-277290277

title: Print `hour<-`() result
body: Great book. Great philosophy.

title: first sentence of penultimate paragraph in page 10
body: After "For each aesthetic you use", there must be a correction to the phrase beginning with "the aes() to associate...". Right now, it does not make sense; perhaps change to: "employ aes() to associate..."

title: exercises 2-5 in pages 9-7
body:
All these exercises should refer to the data mpg, as in exercise 1 before them, not to the data mtcars, which do not have variables drv, hwy or class, for that matter.

Cheers

title: Chap 3 visualize: 3rd example of group aesthetic with geom_smooth(): linetype instead group
body:
The second and third example of group aesthetic with the geom_smooth() function are identical. It seems to me that the third example should refer to the mapping of an aesthetic to a discrete variable (as in the linetype example) in order to demonstrate that a legend will be produced automatically.

(Sorry if I understood or did something wrong. I am a newcomer to R and this is my first pull request in my life… But I very much enjoy your book!)

title: typo: categorcal -> categorical
body: fixing a typo

title: Max -> Mac, .r -> .R
body: Fix one typo, make file extension consistent

title: Pepper-packets may be mislabeled
body:
Being reminded by the pepper-shaker example at rstudio::conf, I have it on good authority that the pepper-packets may be mislabeled:

https://youtu.be/1-vcErOPofQ?t=7m30s

(It will take about a minute of your time)

title: Shading in Figure 3.1 does not appear in print version
body: The figure in the Logical Operators section on p. 47 of the printed book does not have the shading found in the diagrams/transform-logical.png file.

title: Typo
body: Deleted the word "put"

title: 20.5 Vectors : typo in figure 20.2
body: "Figure 20.2 : Subsetting a list, visually", this figure has a small error in it. The last object is a[[4]][[1]][[1]] and not a[[4]][[1]]

title: added hint for cummulative functions
body: This excercise it's difficult. You should also consider moving it to the next section (5.7) when window functions are introduced.

title: Duplicated example
body:
In section 3.6 "Geometric objects" , the 4th set of plots has two duplicates, i.e. 2 of the 3 graphs are the same, generated by the same lines of code: 

ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_smooth(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy, group = drv))

title: Typo in Unusual values
body: the unusually wide limits are either on the y-variable or on the x-axis

title: Update exercise 2 section 3.2.4
body: Did you mean `mpg` instead of `mtcars`?

title: 3.6.1 Exercises // Little error in asked question.
body:
The third question says "What does show.legend = FALSE do? What happens if you remove it?
Why do you think I used it earlier in the chapter?". But the 'show.legend = FALSE' was'nt used earlier in the chapter (I've just checked).
